About Me

Let me tell you a few things ...

BIO

I am a passionate junior Web-Developer and programmer. I got into web-development and programming about a year ago by getting into the part-time Full-stack Web-Development program at DevMountain Coding School in Lehi, Utah. The program enabled me to develop a decent understanding of Javascript, React.js, HTML, CSS, SASS, Node.js, SQL and MongoDB. I have developed a real passion for coding and programming which is something that I anticipated due to its similarity to what I have been doing for my entire life, learning and teaching languages. My 14-year teaching career has helped me be an independant learner to the extent that I can proudly claim that I have taught myself more than 80% of what I know about coding and programming.

Life in Iran

Bachelor's Degree & Getting into Teaching

I am originally from Iran. In 2005, I entered university to do my Bachelor's degree in English Translation and got my first job as an ESL Teacher. I consider this to be one of the most important phases of my life as it was during this time that I learned to be an independant learner and do not depend on instructors and schools to learn things.

Life in Malaysia

Master's Degree

I moved to Malaysia in 2011 in pursuit of a master's degree in TESOL. I got a scholarship at the University of Nottingham and graduated in 2014. This was a really valueable experience in my life as it sparked the inquisitiveness in me and taught me how to be a progressive researcher and combine theory with practice. It was this ability that earned me important positions such as "The Head of R & D" or "The Head of the Linguistics Department" in colleges in Malaysia.

Life in the United States

Getting into Programming

Being an ambitious and progressive individual, I immigrated to the United States with the goal of getting my PhD in TESOL and opening my own school. However, things did not go according to plan as I found out that degrees from universities outside the United States, like my Degree, were not accepted here in America. After doing some research, I realized the great potential in computer programming and a close connection between coding and my language learning/teaching background. After some extensive research I decided to enrol in a part-time Full-stack Web-Development Bootcamp at one of the best coding schools in the nation called DevMountain. DevMountain introduced me to a variety of topics in the field and helped me develop a decent understanding of the basics in the field. I have also been able to build on the knowledge I gained through the bootcamp and develop a deeper understanding of the most important areas and concepts in the field including Javascript, React.js, HTML, CSS, SASS, Node.js, SQL, MongoDB etc.
